hidden_dimensions.name: Durability
hidden_dimensions.description: How long the shoe lasts under normal use before showing significant wear or failure, particularly in the toe box and sole.  This includes resistance to tearing, and general breakdown of materials.

hidden_dimensions.name: Fit Accuracy
hidden_dimensions.description: How accurately the shoe's size corresponds to standard US shoe sizes and whether the shoe runs small, large, narrow or wide.  Includes consistency of sizing across models and brands and accommodating different foot widths.

hidden_dimensions.name: Cushioning and Support
hidden_dimensions.description: The level of cushioning provided for comfort during runs and workouts and the support for the arch and ankle and other pressure points. This also includes shock absorption and bounce.

hidden_dimensions.name: Versatility
hidden_dimensions.description: How well the shoe performs in different activities such as running, walking, working out, or everyday use and across different terrains.

hidden_dimensions.name: Value for Money
hidden_dimensions.description: Users assess the shoe's worth relative to its price, considering factors like durability, comfort, and features. They seek a balance between cost and performance.

hidden_dimensions.name: Style and Aesthetics
hidden_dimensions.description: The shoe's visual appeal, including color options, design, and overall aesthetic. Users consider whether the shoe is fashionable and matches their personal style.
